snippet: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, the high commissioner for human rights, doubled down on remarks he gave last month condemning “nationalist demagogues.”...
abstract: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, United Nations high commissioner for human rights, focuses on Donald J Trump's remarks about use of torture, deportation of undocumented immigrants and ban on Muslims entering United States; says Trump victory in American presidential race would imperil global stability.

byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, the high commissioner for human rights, doubled down on remarks he gave last month condemning “nationalist demagogues.”

headline.main: Donald Trump Is ‘Dangerous’ for Global Stability, U.N. Rights Chief Says
headline.print_headline: U.N. Human Rights Chief Says Trump Is ‘Dangerous’
